content: Manumissions added to the Gospels; Homily

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1r) Her sƿutelað on ðissere cristesbec þæt Ælfƿig se red hæfð geboht hine sylfne ut æt Ælfrige abbod ond eallon hiredemid anon pundeþar is to geƿitnes eall se hired onbaðan crist hine ablende þe þis geƿrit aƿende

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1r) Her sƿutelað on þissere cristesbec þæt Edric æt fordan hæfð geboht Sægyfu his dohtor æt Ælfsige abbod and æt þam hirede onbaðan to ecum freote ond eall hire ofspring

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1r) Her sƿutelað on þisse cristesbec þæt Ælfric scot ond Ægelric scot synd gefreod for Ælsiges abbodes saƿle to ecan freote þis is gedon on ealles hiredes geƿitess

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1r) Her sƿutalað on þissere cristesbec þæt siƿine loofƿies sunu æt lincumbe hafuþ geboht Sydeflæde ut mi fifscyllingam ƿenegan æt Iohanne þam biscope ond æt eallon þam hirede onbaþum to ecum freote. ond herto is geƿittnesse Codric ladda ond Sæƿold ond his tƿegen sunan Scireƿold ond Bruhtƿold.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1v) Her sƿutelað on ðisre cristesbec þæt Iohann hæfð geboht Gunnilde Þurkilles dohtor æt gode leofenaðes lafe to healfan punde. on ealles hiredes geƿittnysse. Crist hine ablende þe þis geƿrit aƿende:- ond he hæfð hi betæht cristeond sancte Petre for his moder saƿle.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1v) Her sƿutelað on ðyssere cristesbec þæt Sæƿig Hagg æt ƿidecume hæfþ gedon ut his tƿegen sunu ætt Ælfsige abbude on ealles hiredes geƿitnesse

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1v) Her sƿutelað on þisse cristesbec þæt Lifgið æt forda is gefreod ond hire tƿa cild. forþone biscop Iohann ond for ealne þone hired onbaðon. on Ælfredes geƿitnesse aspania.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 1v) Her sutelaþ on þisse cristes boc þa forewardan (altered from '-wordan') þe þe prior on baþan

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ond Roðð þe franccisce.

notes.head: Date
notes.body: s. xii

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The text is on erasure, probably of manumissions (Ker 1957, item 35, p. 47).

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1v) Her sƿutelað on þissere cristesbec þæt Ægylmær bohte Sæþryþe æt Sæƿolde abbude. mid.iii.maxan manxan? on ealles hiredes geƿitnesse. ond ofer his dæg ond hys ƿifes dæg beo se man freoh. Crist hine ablende þe þis geƿrit aƿende.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1v) Her sƿutelað on þissere cristesbec þæt Ƿulƿine Hareberd bohte æt Ælƿige abbude Ælfgyþe mid healfan punde. on ealles hiredes geƿitnesse. ond crist hine ablende þe þis geƿrit aƿende

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1v) Her sƿutelað on þissere cristesbec þæt Ægylsige bohte Ƿynric æt Ælƿige abbude mid anon yre goldes þusses ys to geƿitnysse Ælfryd ƿorft gereua ond eal se hired onbaþon. Crist hine ablende þe þis geƿrit aƿende.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 2v) Cum eset desponsata

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 2v) æfter matheus gerecednysse. her is on cneorisse boc. hælendes cristes dauides sunu.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 3r) Cum natus esset Ihesus in bethleem

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 3v) Ecce angelus domini apparuit

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 4r) Defuncto autem

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 4r) Venit ihannes baptista

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 4v) Venit Ihesus agalileo

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 5r) Ductus est Ihesus indesertum

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 5v) Cum audisset Ihesus quod iohannes tradit

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 5v) Amb ulansIhesus iuxta

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 6r) Videns turbas Ihesus

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 6r) Vos estis sal terre

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (medial): (fol. 6v) Quia nisi habundauerit

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 45v) ˥ ic beo mid eoƿ ealle dagas oð ƿorulde ge end un ge. FINIT AMEN.

notes.head: Colophon:
notes.body: Colophon: (fol. 45v) Sit sie hoc Interim. Ego ælfricus scripsi hunc librum imonasterio baðþonio et dedi brihtƿoldo preposito. Qui scripsit uiuat in pace in hoc mundo et in futuro seculo et qui legit legator in eternum

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 46r) Erys godspell ysang yhælyndes Cristes godes suna.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 71r) Soþlice hiƿa farende æghƿar bodedon: drihtne mid ƿyrcendum ond trymmendre spræce æfter fyligendum tacnum.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 71) Men þa leofestan Her onginð þæt halie gewrit þe com fram heofenan into hierusalem

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 72v) on þæs ƿitigan naman he under fehð þæs ƿitigan mede. AMEN.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 73v) Lucas boc ðæs halgan godspelleres.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 147/15) ic Ƿene ne mihte þer middan eard ealle þa bec befon. AMEN.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 114v) Nomina pontificum sedis apostolice

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): (114v) Nomina pontificum sedis apostolice

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: Explicit (Latin): (115v) Hæddan et Wilfridum. postea Wilfridus egectus et Hædda prefatus regebat ambas parrochas

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 116r) On frymƿe ƿæs ƿord ond þætƿord ƿæs mid gode ond God ƿæs þæt ƿord.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 147r) Ƿitodlice oðre manega þing synt þe se hælend ƿorhte gif ða ealle aƿritene ƿæron ic ƿene ne mihte þes middan eard ealle þa bec befon. AMEN.

objectDesc.extent:
c. 304 mm x 211 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
c. 263 mm x 152 mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).
objectDesc.layoutDescription: 27 long lines. Fols 71-72 have been re-ruled in pencil with 34 long lines. The pricking has been cut off by the binder.

characters.note: a is formed with two strokes, the first u-shaped and then a relatively straight, hairline headstroke.
Notably, c is horned.
d is round-backed with a short upstroke that tapers to the right slightly. Very rounded bowl.
e is horned with a tongue that sometimes curves slightly upwards.
The tongue of f is consistently longer than the headstroke.
The tail of g is not closed, and is quite rounded; the downstroke starts from towards the left of the headstroke.
k is very very distinctive: it is a c with a stem attached by a small ligature. 'Cyþað' is spelled 'kyþað' (see fol. 72v).
The ascender of l has a mannered finial.
minims have small feet. Shoulders of n and m are quite angular, as if (and they may be) formed with three strokes: the downstroke, the shoulder and the next limb from the shoulder.
r is quite angular with a distinctive hook at the end.
s is low, but like a Caroline r with a descender. Also high, but not with the well-developed rounded shoulder.
The ascender of þ has a tag to the left.
ð has the longest ascender, with the crossstroke halfway and through the upstroke, with an occasional tick down at upper end.
y is straight-limbed and dotted, with a curve round to the right at bottom.
ascenders all slightly curve to the left.
descenders occasionally have a tag to the left.
accents at 45º with a slight thickening at the end.

abbreviation include þ with a zig-zag line through it (see also Harley 2110, Faustina A. ix and Hatton 115, fols 148-55). In general, the abbreviation mark is like a loose zig-zag. 'Drihten' is abbreviated with a line above the t (like Hatton 116).
Punctuation includes a punctus just above the line; hairline hyphens, which are straight and placed medially or on the line.
correction at fol. 72v by subpunctus and interlinear correction: 'nanu[m] mæn' corrected at line 12 to 'na’ne’ m’an’'. Distinctive sweeping insertion mark like a backward c.

binding: The manuscript shows traces of its Parkerian binding in the partly coloured stains and impressions on fols 1r and 147v of unevenly-trimmed, alum-tawed leather turn-ins. It was sent to the binders in 1748, in a group of 24 manuscripts 'Taken out to be repaired in ye Binding', according to the records in Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, Archives B. 3, fols 88v-89r. The manuscript was rebound again in 1953 with a full binding of native undyed goatskin over millboards by John P. Gray & Son of Cambridge (Budny 1997, pp. 581-82).

history.origin: Written at Bath Abbey, according to the colophon on fol. 45v. The shared format, layout and decoration suggest that the gospels were made in the same place. The additional texts also relate to Bath.
history.provenance: The sixteenth-century annotator's interest in the texts' references to Bath suggest that it remained in Bath perhaps until the dissolution of the Priory in 1539.
history.acquisition: Owned by Matthew Parker, and passed as membra disiecta to the keeping of Corpus Christi College by Parker's indenture of 1757 (Budny 1997, p. 581).

admin: Manuscript described by Elaine Treharne with the assistance of Hollie Morgan, Simon Patterson, Takako Kato and Johanna Green (2010; 2012).
